title: China Eximbank provides $143.9 million preferential buyer’s credit for Second Stage of Phase 1 of the Dushanbe-Dangara Road Reconstruction Project (Linked to Project ID #40063, #40440)
description:
On November 27, 2010, the Export-Import Bank of China and the Ministry of Finance of the Republic of Tajikistan signed a $143,925,000 preferential buyer’s credit (PBC) loan agreement [China Eximbank PBC NO.2010 (025) Total No. (132)] for the Second Stage of the Phase 1 of the Dushanbe-Dangara Road Reconstruction Project. This loan carried an interest rate of 2%, a maturity of 20 years, and a grace period of 5 years. The total project cost was $151,500,000, including a contribution of $7,575,000 from the Government of Tajikistan. 

China Road & Bridge Corporation was awarded the implementation contract. The project is implemented in the design and construction contracting mode. The main construction content includes road reconstruction, municipal road engineering, tunnels and connecting lines, etc. The road repair project construction period is 24 months, and the tunnel and connection line construction period is 36 months. Construction began on October 15, 2010, and ths project was completed (after passing final inspection) on October 30, 2013. 

This project supported the reconstruction of a 50.5 km road segment along the 147.64 km Dushanbe-Vahdat-Dangara section of the Dushanbe-Kulma highway (which is also known as the Tajikistan-China highway). It also supported the construction of the 4.43 km Chormagzak Tunnel along the 147.64 km Dushanbe-Dangara section of the Dushanbe-Kulma highway. More detailed locational information can be found at https://reconnectingasia.csis.org/database/projects/carec-dushanbekulma-road-dushanbe-dangara-section-phase-2/9d21c81e-6931-4df6-9dd4-650c86518ecb/ at https://www.google.com/maps/place/Chormaghzak+Tunnel,+Tajikistan/@38.4771348,69.1814159,17z/data=!3m1!4b1!4m5!3m4!1s0x38b66e9dde37093f:0x45059c2b6cd21c12!8m2!3d38.4771306!4d69.1836046.” 

STAFF_NOTE: This project is linked to the China Eximbank-financed First Stage and China Eximbank-financed Third Stage of Phase 1 of the Dushanbe-Dangara Road Reconstruction Project (see Project ID#40063, #40440). China Eximbank reportedly provided $243.4 million of debt financing in total for all three stages of Phase 1. The Russian project title for Stage 2 of Phase 1 is Реконструкция второго этапа Фаза I автомобильной дороги «Душанбе-Кульма» (Таджикистан – граница Китая) на участке «Душанбе - Дангара». The Chinese project title is 塔中公路一期(杜尚别—丹卡拉段)道路修复改造项目.

title: China Eximbank provides $143.9 million preferential buyer’s credit for Second Stage of Phase 1 of the Dushanbe-Dangara Road Reconstruction Project (Linked to Project ID #40063, #40440)

title: China Development Bank loans RMB 33 million to the State Savings Bank of Tajikistan 'Amonatbonk' (Linked to Project ID#40481, #40482, #40479, #72802)
description:
On May 20, 2013, several loan agreements between the State Savings Bank of Tajikistan "Amonatbonk" and China Development Bank of China (CDB) were signed (see "Пресс-релизы : Официальные переговоры на высшем уровне между Республикой Таджикистан и Китайской Народной Республикой") for on-lending activities. The RMB portion of the agreements totaled to RMB 33 million, however no breakdown of the individual agreements was found. Part of loans will be used for financing Tajik agricultural sectors. 

The loans were part of a series of investments made on May 20th during President of Tajikistan Emomalii Rahmon's visit to China. These other projects were: a collection of loans totaling USD 20 million to Amonatbonk (captured in project ID#72802 ), a 200 million RMB grant (captured in project ID#40481), an agreement for the reconstruction of Regar Substation (captured in project ID#40482), a loan to Zijin Mining for investment into the Zeravshan Gold Mine (captured in project ID#40479), a technical cooperation agreement, a fruit inspection protocol, and a sports cooperation agreement.
sources: https://www.amonatbonk.tj/en/international/investments/, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; https://www.timesca.com/index.php/news/8025-china-allocates-140-million-for-tajik-gold-mining-company, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://minfin.tj/index.php?newsid=461, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://amonatbonk.tj/tj/about/news/2757/, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.prezident.tj/en/node/4408, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://jamestown.org/program/china-as-tajikistans-lender-of-last-resort/, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient); https://asiaplustj.info/en/news/tajikistan/politics/20130520/china-reportedly-expected-allot-200-million-yuan-no-strings-tajikistan, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.asiaplustj.info/en/news/tajikistan/economic/20130520/president-rahmon-meets-top-managers-two-china-s-leading-banks-beijing, Media Report, including Wikileaks
GEO_notes: The loans are going towards financing the Tajik agricultural sector. However, there was no information on where these sectors were located so it was coded up to country level.

title: China Eximbank provides $50.54 million preferential buyer’s credit for Third Stage (Chormagzak Tunnel) of Phase 1 of the Dushanbe-Dangara Road Reconstruction Project (Linked to Project ID #53750, #40063)
description:
On June 5, 2012, the Export-Import Bank of China and the Ministry of Finance of the Republic of Tajikistan signed a loan agreement for the provision of $50.54 million USD for the Third Stage of the Phase 1 of the Dushanbe-Dangara Road Reconstruction Project (see "'Eximbank" to Provide Over $ 50 million for Continuing Reconstruction of Dushanbe-Kulma Road'"). The loan had a maturity period of 20 years, a grace period of 9 years, and an interest rate of 2%. The Government of Tajikistan contributed $2.7 million USD to this project. The Eximbank loan was unanimously ratified by the Tajik Parliament in October 2012.

China Road and Bridge Corporation (CRBC) was the contractor responsible for project implementation. Construction began on October 15, 2010, and the project was completed on October 1, 2013. This project supported the construction of the 4.43 km Chormagzak Tunnel along the 147.64 km Dushanbe-Dangara section of the Dushanbe-Kulma highway (which is also known as the Tajikistan-China highway). More detailed locational information can be found at https://www.google.com/maps/place/Chormaghzak+Tunnel,+Tajikistan/@38.4771348,69.1814159,17z/data=!3m1!4b1!4m5!3m4!1s0x38b66e9dde37093f:0x45059c2b6cd21c12!8m2!3d38.4771306!4d69.1836046 and https://reconnectingasia.csis.org/database/projects/carec-dushanbekulma-road-dushanbe-dangara-section-phase-2/9d21c81e-6931-4df6-9dd4-650c86518ecb/.

STAFF_NOTE: The Chormagzak Tunnel is now known as the Khatlon Tunnel. This project is linked to the China Eximbank-financed First Stage and China Eximbank-financed Second Stage of Phase 1 of the Dushanbe-Dangara Road Reconstruction Project (see Project ID#40063, #53750). China Eximbank reportedly provided $243.4 million of debt financing in total for all three stages of Phase 1. The Russian project title for Stage 3 of Phase 1 is Реабилитация третьего этапа фазы I автомобильной дороги «Душанбе-Кульма». The Chinese project title is 塔中公路一期(杜尚别—丹卡拉段)道路修复改造项目.

Additionally, the "Data Collection Survey On a Road Between Dushanbe and Kurgan-Tyube in the Republic of Tajikistan Final Report" from the Japan International Cooperation Agency states that China Eximbank provided a $64 million USD loan for this project, but most of other sources (including Tajikistan Ministry report and ADB investigation) indicate that $50.54 would be a more precise number.

title: China Eximbank provides $50.54 million preferential buyer’s credit for Third Stage (Chormagzak Tunnel) of Phase 1 of the Dushanbe-Dangara Road Reconstruction Project (Linked to Project ID #53750, #40063)
description:
On June 5, 2012, the Export-Import Bank of China and the Ministry of Finance of the Republic of Tajikistan signed a loan agreement for the provision of $50.54 million USD for the Third Stage of the Phase 1 of the Dushanbe-Dangara Road Reconstruction Project (see "'Eximbank" to Provide Over $ 50 million for Continuing Reconstruction of Dushanbe-Kulma Road'"). The loan had a maturity period of 20 years, a grace period of 9 years, and an interest rate of 2%. The Government of Tajikistan contributed $2.7 million USD to this project. The Eximbank loan was unanimously ratified by the Tajik Parliament in October 2012.

China Road and Bridge Corporation (CRBC) was the contractor responsible for project implementation. Construction began on October 15, 2010, and the project was completed on October 1, 2013. This project supported the construction of the 4.43 km Chormagzak Tunnel along the 147.64 km Dushanbe-Dangara section of the Dushanbe-Kulma highway (which is also known as the Tajikistan-China highway). More detailed locational information can be found at https://www.google.com/maps/place/Chormaghzak+Tunnel,+Tajikistan/@38.4771348,69.1814159,17z/data=!3m1!4b1!4m5!3m4!1s0x38b66e9dde37093f:0x45059c2b6cd21c12!8m2!3d38.4771306!4d69.1836046 and https://reconnectingasia.csis.org/database/projects/carec-dushanbekulma-road-dushanbe-dangara-section-phase-2/9d21c81e-6931-4df6-9dd4-650c86518ecb/.

STAFF_NOTE: The Chormagzak Tunnel is now known as the Khatlon Tunnel. This project is linked to the China Eximbank-financed First Stage and China Eximbank-financed Second Stage of Phase 1 of the Dushanbe-Dangara Road Reconstruction Project (see Project ID#40063, #53750). China Eximbank reportedly provided $243.4 million of debt financing in total for all three stages of Phase 1. The Russian project title for Stage 3 of Phase 1 is Реабилитация третьего этапа фазы I автомобильной дороги «Душанбе-Кульма». The Chinese project title is 塔中公路一期(杜尚别—丹卡拉段)道路修复改造项目.

Additionally, the "Data Collection Survey On a Road Between Dushanbe and Kurgan-Tyube in the Republic of Tajikistan Final Report" from the Japan International Cooperation Agency states that China Eximbank provided a $64 million USD loan for this project, but most of other sources (including Tajikistan Ministry report and ADB investigation) indicate that $50.54 would be a more precise number.

title: Chinese Government provides RMB 8 million grant for provision of switches in the Danghara region and equipment related to CDMA projects by ZTE
description: According to the Economic and Commercial Office of the Chinese Embassy in Tajikistan, sometime before July 2003, China provided a RMB 8 million grant to Tajikistan. As agreed by China and Tajikistan, the aid was to be used to provide switches to the Danghara region and to provide equipment for the implementation of CDMA projects. ZTE was responsible for its implementation, and as of July 2003, the project was progressing smoothly in its implementation phase.
sources: http://tj.mofcom.gov.cn/article/ztdy/200307/20030700109512.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.jstor.org/stable/4147497?seq=1, Other Academic (Working Paper, Dissertation)
GEO_notes: Coded the Danghara District. The title and the description gave Danghara as the location adn no other inforamtion contradicted this.

title: China Eximbank provides $267.2 million preferential buyer's credit for 500 kV North-South Power Transmission Line Project (Linked to Project ID#39984, #70910)
description:
In March 2006, the Government of Tajikistan and the Export-Import Bank of China signed a MoU for projects proposed by Tajikistan (see pg. 14 of "China as an Emerging Donor in Tajikistan and Kyrgyzstan"). Later, on December 21, 2006, the Export-Import Bank of China provided a $267,219,451 USD preferential buyer’s credit (PBC) loan to the Ministry of Finance of the Republic of Tajikistan for the 500 kV North-South Power Transmission Line Project (for the transaction amount, see pg. 87 of "Power Utility Financial Recovery Program-for-Results (P168211) Program Technical Assessment Final Report"). The loan terms carried the following terms: a maturity period of 20 years, a grace period of 5 to 7 years, and an interest rate of 2% (for the loan details, see "List of Chinese Government-Financed Projects in Tajikistan from the Ministry of Finance via the IMF May 2018"). 

The Government of Tajikistan used the proceeds from this PBC loan to on-lend (through subsidiary loan agreement (No. BLA06015, #6015) to Open Joint Stock Holding Company (OHSHC) “Barqi Tojik” at a 3% interest rate between December 21, 2006 and June 21, 2026. As of December 31, 2018, $2,519,773 USD was still outstanding. OHSHC “Barqi Tojik” was a state-owned enterprise in Tajikistan responsible for the generation, transmission, and distribution of electricity and thermal energy. 

The initial estimated value of the project was $281.3 million USD.The purpose of this project was to construct a 500 kV electricity transmission line that would connect the northern Sughd region to the national grid. According to Xinhua, the project also intended to realize the effective dispatching of electricity between Dushanbe and Khujand, completely solve the problem of power shortage in the south during the dry season in winter, build the transmission channel for the implementation of the Tajik Hydropower Strategy, improve the safety, stability, and reliability of the power grid, and reduce the loss of electricity through transmission from 14% to 3.2%. 

Tebian Electric Apparatus Stock (TBEA) was the contractor responsible for project implementation. Construction began on September 16, 2006. The North-South transmission line has been operational since November 29, 2009, according to TBEA's report. The construction of the 325 km, 500 kV south–north power transmission line reportedly enabled Tajikistan to become independent of the Uzbek power transmission network and to distribute electricity throughout the country. 

The project is linked to project ID#70910, which captured a $51 million funding from Eximbank in 2009 for both the 500 kV North-South Power Transmission Line project and a 220 kV Lolazor-Khatlon Transmission Line Project (The original financing of the 220 kV project in 2006 was captured in project ID#39984). 

STAFF_NOTE: The Russian project title is Строительство ЛЭП 500 кВ “Юг-Север”. The Chinese project title is 塔吉克斯坦南北220—500kV输变电成套工程. Additionally, China Eximbank indicates that this project was financed by preferential export buyer's credit in the '重大项目 Major Projects' document.
